data.subject: FR
data.title: Beginner French
data.description: An intensive beginner course for students having no prior knowledge of French. Emphasizes listening, reading, writing, and oral communication skills.
data.notes: [Note: Not open to students who have completed some elementary or high school French, or FR 151. Not open to students with advanced, near-native or native ability in French.]

data.subject: FR
data.title: Basic French 1
data.description: For students with some elementary or secondary school French not exceeding Year Two (Grade Ten in Ontario) or equivalent. Emphasizes comprehension, grammar and basic speaking skills.
data.prerequisites: FR 101 or Ontario Grade 9 or 10 French.
data.antirequisites:
Ontario Grade 11
French or 4U Core French or Immersion French or Extended French
data.notes: [Note: Not open to students who have completed high school French immersion program or FR 152. Not open to students with advanced, near-native or native ability in French.]

data.subject: FR
data.title: Basic French 2
data.description: For students with some elementary or secondary school French, not exceeding Year Three (Grade 11 in Ontario) or equivalent. Emphasizes comprehension, grammar, and basic speaking skills.
data.antirequisites: Ontario Grade 12 French or 4U Core French or Immersion French or Extended French.
data.notes: [Note: Not open to students who have completed high school French immersion program. Not open to students with advanced, near-native or native ability in French.]

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Language 1: Module 1
data.description: An intensive French Language course. Vocabulary enrichment and development of reading, writing and oral expression.
data.antirequisites: High School Immersion French, Extended French, near-native or native ability in French; FR 192B

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Language 1: Module 2
data.description: An intensive French Language course. Vocabulary enrichment and development of reading, writing and oral expression.
data.prerequisites: High School Immersion French or Extended French or FR 192A.
data.antirequisites: Near-native or native ability in French.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Culture & Literature: Origins to 1715
data.description: A survey of French culture and literature from their origins to 1715.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Introduction to Phonetics of French
data.description: An introduction to the structure of the French sound system with a view to improving pronunciation. Careful attention will be paid to the individual student's difficulties.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Intermediate Spoken French
data.description: A course intended to develop the oral and aural skills.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Language 2: Module 1
data.description: Intensive work on grammar and written French.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Language 2: Module 2
data.description: Intensive work on grammar and written French.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Business French I
data.description: A French language course designed to enable the student to carry on standard business practice in spoken and written French.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Major Works 1 - France and la francophonie
data.description: A study of selected major texts of the 20th century of France and the francophone world.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Introduction to Literature: Quebec and French Canada
data.description: A study of selected contemporary literary works of French Canada.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Civilization 1
data.description: This course traces the cultural development of France from its origin to the French Revolution. Emphasis is given to the study of music, art, architecture, literature, ideas, and daily life in their historical context.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Civilization 2
data.description: This course completes the study of the cultural development of France from the French Revolution to the present.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Culture & Literature: 1715 to the Present
data.description: A survey of French culture and literature from 1715 to the present.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Advanced Spoken French
data.description: An advanced level course intended to continue intensive oral and aural skill development.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Introduction to Linguistics
data.description: An introduction to the basic principles of linguistic analysis (as opposed to traditional grammar) applied to the sounds, vocabulary and sentence structure of contemporary standard French and certain features of current Canadian French. Students' language learning needs will be an important feature of the course.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 17th-Century French Literature
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of 17th-century French literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 17th-Century French Literature
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of 17th-century French literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 17th-Century French Literature
data.description: A continuation of FR 332A.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 18th-Century French Literature
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of 18th-century French literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 18th-Century French Literature
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of 18th-century French literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 18th-Century French Literature
data.description: A continuation of FR 343A.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Language 3
data.description: Intensive development of writing skills through a study of stylistics and advanced composition.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Introduction to Translation
data.description: Introduction to the theories and practices of French-English/English-French translation.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 19th-Century French Literature
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of 19th-century French literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 19th-Century French Literature
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of 19th-century French literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 19th-Century French Literature
data.description: A continuation of FR 354A.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Business French II
data.description: A French language course designed to enhance written and oral expression through the study of economic and business topics in the social and economic contexts of Canada and France.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 20th-Century French Literature
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of 20th-century French literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 20th-Century French Literature
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of 20th-century French literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 20th-Century French Literature
data.description: A continuation of FR 363A.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Theatre
data.description: A study of selected plays in French.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 21st-Century French Literature
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of 21st-century French literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Languages in Contact: The History of French-English Bilingualism
data.description: This course will examine, from a historical and sociolinguistic perspective, the long-standing rivalry of our country's two official languages, the origins of their relationship, and the socio-political and linguistic implications of bilingualism.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Quebec Literature
data.description: A study of selected texts by modern French-Canadian authors.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Language Practice
data.description: Intensive French language practice in an immersion setting.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Language Practice
data.description: A continuation of FR 392A.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Civilization, 20th-Century French History
data.description: An overview of contemporary French civilization.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Civilization, 20th-Century French History
data.description: A continuation of FR 393A.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Thought
data.description: A survey of the principal thinkers and currents of ideas in France from the Renaissance to the present.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Thought
data.description: A continuation of FR 395A.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Independent Cultural Study
data.description: An independent study course, in which the student chooses an area of French life on which to make a detailed study (topic must be approved by the Department). A written cultural studies report is submitted, on which the student is examined orally.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Advanced Translation
data.description: Intensive development of advanced comparative stylistics, translation and composition skills.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Topics in Linguistics
data.description: A study of selected topics in Linguistics. Topics will be chosen by the professor according to his/her area of specialization.
data.notes: [Note: This is a repeatable course, subject to different content; it may be completed a total of three times.]

data.subject: FR
data.title: Medieval French Language
data.description: Introduction to the early development of French.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Medieval French Literature
data.description: An introduction to French literature of the Middle Ages through the study of representative texts.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 16th-Century French Literature
data.description: A focused study of a particular theme of Renaissance (1500-1600) writing.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 16th-Century French Literature
data.description: A focused study of a particular theme of Renaissance (1500-1600) writing.

data.subject: FR
data.title: 16th-Century French Literature
data.description: A continuation of FR 424A.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Advanced French Language
data.description: Intensive study of French composition, style and grammar.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Francophone Literatures in Canada
data.description: A detailed study of a selected genre or aspect of French-Canadian literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Aspects of French Canada
data.description: A presentation of traditional and contemporary French Canada in the fields of the arts, literature, music, politics and society.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Study of Individual Authors
data.description: A focused study of an individual author. Author selected will vary from offering to offering.
data.notes: [Note: This course is repeatable up to three times, subject to different content.]

data.subject: FR
data.title: Introduction to Literary Theory
data.description: A survey of critical approaches to literary texts.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Children's Literature in French
data.description: A detailed study of selected aspects of French and French-Canadian children's literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Women Writers
data.description: A study of selected works by women writers in France from the Middle Ages to the 21st-century. The course will focus on the literary features of these works and on their value as reflections of the position of women in French society throughout the period.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Topics in French and Francophone Cultural Studies
data.description: A study of selected topics in French and Francophone cultural studies. Topics will be chosen by the professor according to their area of specialization.
data.notes: [Note: This is a repeatable course, subject to different content; it may be completed a total of three times.]

data.subject: FR
data.title: African and Caribbean French Literature
data.description: A detailed survey of selected Francophone writers from outside Europe and Canada.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Francophone Literature and Psychoanalytic Theory
data.description: A study of contemporary French and Francophone literary works in light of psychoanalytic theory.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Senior Tutorials
data.description: A small group of students follows a course of study under the supervision of a faculty member. For details, inquire of the Department.

data.title: Senior Tutorials
data.description: A small group of students follows a course of study under the supervision of a faculty member. For details, inquire of the Department.

data.title: Senior Tutorials
data.description: A small group of students follows a course of study under the supervision of a faculty member. For details, inquire of the Department.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Senior Tutorials
data.description: A small group of students follows a course of study under the supervision of a faculty member. For details, inquire of the Department.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Research Methods and Professional Communication in French Studies
data.description: This course comprises an introduction to research tools (bibliographies, databases, etc.); an introduction to means of disseminating research (conferences, publications, etc); and a series of workshops devoted to professionalization (scholarship and grant applications, preparation of the academic cv and teaching dossier, professional communication, career options outside of the academia, etc.).  This course is compulsory for all MA level students and for PhD students who have not taken a research methods course during their MA studies.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Topics in North African Literature
data.description: In this course we will study literary texts of different genres and writers from the Maghreb region.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Language 3: Module 2
data.description: Intensive development of writing skills through a study of stylistics and advanced composition.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Medieval French Literature
data.description: An introduction to French literature of the Middle Ages through the study of representative texts.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Medieval French Literature
data.description: An introduction to French literature of the Middle Ages through the study of representative texts.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French-Canadian Literature
data.description: A detailed study of a selected genre or aspect of French-Canadian literature.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French-Canadian Literature
data.description: A continuation of FR 471A.

data.subject: FR
data.title: French Culture & Literature: Origins to 1715

data.subject: FR
data.title: Community Fieldwork in French
data.description: This graduate practicum in French community work offers advanced experiential learning in an area related to the student¿s professional interest. A student wishing to pursue this possibility must submit to the Associate Chair, Graduate Studies, a proposal that outlines the plans for the practicum (e.g., the organizing unit, the on-site supervision, the nature of the community work, the relevance to the French graduate program) and the arrangements for evaluation.

data.subject: FR
data.title: Research or Professional Practicum in French
data.description: This graduate practicum in French offers advanced experiential learning in an area related to the student¿s professional or research interest. A student wishing to pursue this possibility must submit to the Associate Chair, Graduate Studies, a proposal that outlines the plans for the practicum (e.g., the organizing unit, the on-site supervisor, the nature of the professional or research work, the relevance to the French graduate program) and the arrangements for evaluation.
